The new `realtR` package looks wonderful from the screenshot from [Alex Bresler](https://twitter.com/abresler/status/972997469872316417)!
![realtR](https://pbs.twimg.com/media/DXylf3QWkAAjb85.jpg)
Install with devtools.

```{r}
devtools::install_github("abresler/requestsR")
devtools::install_github("abresler/requestsR")
```
Now let's try it out:

```{r}
# library(reticulate)
# library(jsonlite)
library(requestsR)
# library(rvest)
# library(listviewer)
library(realtR)
library(tidyverse)

reticulate::use_python("/Users/myhome/anaconda/bin/python") # Use Anaconda not system PY
```

Try listings:

```{r}

my_neighbors <- realtR::listings(locations = c("Houston, TX", 77024, "Austin, TX"),
                                 beds_min = 4)

```
Try to confirm 'requestR' was installed correctly

```{r}

resp <- Get(url = 'https://api.github.com/events')

pyjson <- 
  resp %>%
  parse_response_json(is_data_frame = F)
```
Try use jsonlite directly
```{r}
x <- resp$content

jsonlite::fromJSON(a, flatten = T)
```

```{r}
a = substring(x, 2)

jsonlite::fromJSON(a, flatten = T)

```
Py info

```{r}
print(reticulate::py_config())
```
